p: Little has been reported on the antibacterial activity of Myracrodruon urundeuva essential oil [ 27]. However, studies of other essential oils from the same plant (with different chemical compositions) have been tested against some of the bacteria herein tested. Among these, S. aureus [ 26, 35â€“ 37], E. coli [ 26, 36, 37], and P. aeruginosa [ 37], were inhibited by such extracts, showing the antimicrobial activity of M. urundeuva.
